SEARCH
Package myproject

Class Backend

java.lang.Object
myproject.Backend
public class Backend extends Object
The `Backend` class provides methods to interact with a database for managing inventory and orders. This class contains methods for connecting to a database, performing queries, and executing various operations related to inventory management, orders, and reports. It facilitates operations such as retrieving item information, creating new orders, updating items, and generating sales and restock reports. The class establishes a connection to the database and provides a set of functionalities to interact with it.

  • Constructor Details

      public Backend()

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public boolean connect()
      This is a method that will create a connection with the database. This will catch any errors thrown during .getConnection().
      Returns:
      Boolean value representing if the connection is created or not

    • query

      public ResultSet query(String sqlStatement)
      This is a function that will take a sql statement and query the database. It will catch any exceptions thrown by executeQuery.
      Parameters:
      sqlStatement - values that holds the sqlStatement
      Returns:
      ResultSet that holds the data of the query

    • getItemId

      public String getItemId(String name)
      Retrieve the item ID from the database based on the provided item name. This method retrieves the item ID associated with a specific item name from the database. It performs a case-insensitive search for the item name, and if a match is found, it returns the corresponding item ID.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the item for which to retrieve the item ID.
      Returns:
      A string representing the item ID, or an empty string if no match is found.

    • getName

      public String getName(String id)
      Retrieve the Name of a stock item from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - String value that holds the id of the item we are looking for.
      Returns:
      A String value that is the name of the value we are looking for, will return an empty string if no match is found.

    • createOrder

      public void createOrder(ArrayList<String> orderItems, Stack<Double> prices, String totalPrice, int itemCount)
      Create a new order in the database. This method allows you to create a new order in the database by specifying a list of order items, their corresponding prices, the total price of the order, and the total number of items in the order. The method generates a new order ID, records the order in the database with date and time information, and adds the order items to the order.
      Parameters:
      orderItems - A list of item names to be included in the order.
      prices - A stack of item prices corresponding to the order items.
      totalPrice - The total price of the order.
      itemCount - The total number of items in the order.

    • createOrderItem

      public void createOrderItem(String itemName, String order_id, Double price)
      Create a new order item in the database. This method allows you to create a new order item in the database by specifying the item name, order ID, and price. The method reduces the item's quantity in stock by 1 and records the order item in the database.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to be added to the order.
      order_id - The ID of the order to which the item is added.
      price - The price of the item.

    • createFoodItem

      public void createFoodItem(String name, Float newPrice, Integer newStock, Integer newMin, String foodtype, String season)
      Create a new food item in the database. This method allows you to create a new food item in the database by specifying its name. The method automatically generates a new item ID, sets default values for stock and price, and records the creation date.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new food item to be created.
      newPrice - The price of the food item.
      newStock - The initial stock quantity of the food item.
      newMin - The minimum stock quantity allowed for the food item.
      foodtype - The type of food item ("vessel," "ice cream," "topping," or "other").
      season - The seasonal information for the food item (e.g., "none" for non-seasonal items).

    • createNonFoodItem

      public void createNonFoodItem(String name, float newPrice, int newStock, int newMin)
      Create a new non-food item in the database. This method allows you to create a new non-food item in the database by specifying its name. The method automatically generates a new item ID, sets default values for stock and price, and records the creation date.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new food item to be created.
      newPrice - The price of the food item.
      newStock - The initial stock quantity of the food item.
      newMin - The minimum stock quantity allowed for the food item.

    • updateItem

      public void updateItem(String itemName, String colName, String value)
      Update an item's property in the database. This method allows you to update a specific property (column) of an item in the database. You need to specify the item's name, the name of the column you want to update, and the new value for that column.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item you want to update.
      colName - The name of the column (property) to be updated.
      value - The new value to set for the specified column.

    • getStockItems

      public ArrayList<String> getStockItems()
      Retrieves a list of all stock items. This method queries the database to retrieve the names of all stock items in the inventory.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings containing the names of all stock items. If no items are found or an error occurs, an empty ArrayList is returned.

    • getFoodItems

      public ArrayList<String> getFoodItems()
      Retrieves a list of food-related items. This method queries the database to retrieve the names of food-related items, including food, ice cream, and vessels.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings containing the names of food-related items. If no items are found or an error occurs, an empty ArrayList is returned.

    • getNonFoodItems

      public ArrayList<String> getNonFoodItems()
      Retrieves a list of non-food items. This method queries the database to retrieve the names of non-food items that are not categorized as food, ice cream, vessels, or toppings.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings containing the names of non-food items. If no items are found or an error occurs, an empty ArrayList is returned.

    • getPrice

      public float getPrice(String name)
      Retrieves the price of an item by its name. This method queries the database to find the price of an item with a name that matches the provided name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the item to get the price for.
      Returns:
      A floating-point number representing the price of the item. If the item is not found or an error occurs, 0.0 is returned.

    • getStock

      public int getStock(String name)
      Retrieves the stock quantity of an item by its name. This method queries the database to find the stock quantity of an item with a name that matches the provided name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the item to get the stock quantity for.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the stock quantity of the item. If the item is not found or an error occurs, 0 is returned.

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      This method closes the connection with the DB.

    • restockReport

      public ResultSet restockReport()
      This function retrieves information for the restock report from the database. It queries for items which have a quantity below the minimum allowed quantity and returns a ResultSet containing them. This function is used to provide information to create the restock table on the Manager POS.
      Returns:
      ResultSet

    • seasonalInfo

      public ResultSet seasonalInfo()
      This function retrieves information on the seasonal items from the database. It queries for seasonal items from the stockitem table and returns a ResultSet containing relevant data. This function is used to add seasonal items to the Cashier POS.
      Returns:
      ResultSet

    • salesReport

      public ResultSet salesReport(String startDate, String endDate)
      Retrieves a sales report as a ResultSet for a specified date range. This method queries the database to retrieve sales data for items within the specified date range. The sales report includes item names, total quantities sold, and total sales amounts, sorted by total sales amount in descending order.
      Parameters:
      startDate - A String representing the start date in the format "YYYY-MM-DD."
      endDate - A String representing the end date in the format "YYYY-MM-DD."
      Returns:
      A ResultSet containing the sales report data, including item names, total quantities sold, and total sales amounts.

    • whatSellsReport

      public ResultSet whatSellsReport(String startDate, String endDate)
      Retrieves the report for what sells together option This function will use a query that will count the pair combinations of certain items thoughout the orderitems in between a start and end date
      Parameters:
      startDate - A string value that represents the start date of the query in YYYY-MM-DD format
      endDate - A string value that represents the end date of the query in YYYY-MM-DD format
      Returns:
      a ResultSet of the query

    • ExcessReport

      public ArrayList<String> ExcessReport(String date)
      Retrieves the excess report. This function will create a view that combines the item id and date of the purchse of that item and then will use a query that will count the number of times that items was purchase starting at the start date and going until the curr date, then will delete the view
      Parameters:
      date - A String values that represents that date that you should start querying at until the curr date
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings that holds the name of excess items

    • getSeasonalFlavors

      public List<String> getSeasonalFlavors(String season)
      Retrieve a list of seasonal ice cream flavors based on the given season. This method queries the database to find and return a list of seasonal ice cream flavors for the specified season.
      Parameters:
      season - The season for which to retrieve seasonal ice cream flavors (e.g., "summer", "fall").
      Returns:
      A list of seasonal ice cream flavor names available in the database for the specified season.

    • getFlavors

      public List<String> getFlavors()
      Retrieve a list of all available ice cream flavors. This method queries the database to find and return a list of ice cream flavors.
      Returns:
      A list of ice cream flavor names available in the database.

    • getSeasonalVessel

      public List<String> getSeasonalVessel(String season)
      Retrieve a list of seasonal vessel names based on the specified season. This method queries the database to find and return a list of vessel names that are associated with the specified season and marked as seasonal vessels.
      Parameters:
      season - The season for which to retrieve seasonal vessels (e.g., "summer," "fall," etc.).
      Returns:
      A list of seasonal vessel names associated with the specified season.

    • getItemPrice

      public String getItemPrice(String itemName)
      Retrieve the price of an item by its name. This method queries the database to find the price of an item with a name that matches the provided name in a case-insensitive manner. If the item is found, it returns the price as a string. If the item is not found or an error occurs, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item for which to get the price.
      Returns:
      A string representing the price of the item, or null if the item is not found or an error occurs.

    • UsageReportNumbers

      public ArrayList<Integer> UsageReportNumbers(String startDate, String endDate)
      Retrieves the usage report. This function will create a view that combines the item id and date of the purchse of that item and then will use a query that will count the number of times that items was purchase starting at the start date and going until the curr date, then will delete the view
      Parameters:
      startDate - A String values that represents that date that you should start
      endDate - A String values that represents that date that you should end
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings that holds the counts of used items

    • UsageReportNames

      public ArrayList<String> UsageReportNames(String startDate, String endDate)
      Retrieves the usage report. This function will create a view that combines the item id and date of the purchse of that item and then will use a query that will count the number of times that items was purchase starting at the start date and going until the curr date, then will delete the view
      Parameters:
      startDate - A String values that represents that date that you should start
      endDate - A String values that represents that date that you should end
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of strings that holds the name of used items
